message: i'm gonna have to go with Pandora

spotify's awesome, wish we had it in the states
@artmsilva wow, rdio looks really slick, had not heard of it before
I use Winamp whenever I'm playing my own local music. I generally use Grooveshark if I want to stream from my computer and Pandora if I want to stream from my phone.
@neonskimmer yeah it has a small but strong community behind it.
Mugasha
i still love itunes, mainly for the smart playlists feature, which I can't live without
I spit on iTunes (on windows). I absolutely hate it. and I hate that my iPod forces me to even have it on the PC. Mostly I use winamp and sharepod for the simple task of pputting music on the ipod.
I'm using Clementine ...
soundcloud mac app is great <3
@jbond I completely agree. I can't stand iTunes, and the dependence on it has made me avoid ever jumping onto the iPod bandwagon. I'll stick with Winamp.
Sharepod ++ It's small enough that you can put in the disk area of the ipod. Zero install. It means you can copy music on and off any windows machine.
@JohnFail There are actually quite a few ways to work with an iPod that doesn't involve iTunes at all. I use gtkpod on Linux, for example.

@Raynes I know there are other applications which work (I know Amarok allows iPod syncing as well), but some of those implementations run into issues of their own. I just figure it's easier to avoid the mess and stay away from iPods for fewer headaches if you aren't willing to put up with iTunes.
@JohnFail So what PMP do you use if it's not an iPod?
does anyone produce/write music? what kind of apps do you use for that?
Cubase.  It's quite nice.
@choxi nanostudio is a great on iPad for sequencing and analog synth sounds - Logic on the laptop
hola!! you like rap?
just got garageband on iPad and it is AWESOME at first glance - possibly the best music apps I've seen
I have my own iPhone/iTunes ass as well.

I compose my own misic using a Yamaha keboard and Micro KORG. I also use Sony Acid Pro for tracks editing, and a program called Vocalizer to add cool voice effects. I haven't reated and music with the voice effects but have over 90 original instrumental track. If you go to my site (daviej.com) and click Buy My Music you can hear samples of them.
On my mac, COG. I hate Itunes
on linux, MPD
I've been pushing Zune Desktop on all Windows users I know
I stumbled upon it by accident, and was totally shocked to see how awesome it is
I don't own a Zune, but for music on the computer, it's amazing - both beautiful and functional

How do you get Zune
i use itunes mostly (but i think it's a horrible media manager) mediamonkey has been my long time fav and songbird is really growing on me (even more so that it has an android app)
@JohnFail Don't get me wrong, I can't stand iPods and don't see myself ever buying another one. Just sayin'.
@jbond I'm fairly fond of my Android phone as a media player. I use PowerAMP.

I will second MediaMonkey as a long time favorite!  I'm transitioning to MM4 for my music manager and podcast catcher since it's fairly stable now.  It will catalog and play your video too.  I haven't tried converting video but when it's done, MM4 should convert video as easily as it converts audio
